g:HTMLPanel.i: "CleanSheets is the first spreadsheet application that is both extensible and platform-independent. It features a formula language that closely resembles that of Microsoft Excel, and extensions for aiding end-user programmers develop correct spreadsheets."

m:MaterialLabel.text: This is how the application is described by its original author, Einar Pehrson.

g:HTMLPanel.div:
Cleansheets is a java-based desktop application.
The original Cleansheets project has been forked and used in several editions of the project of the LAPR4 course, from 2011/12 until 2016/17 (6 editions of the course).
The Project includes adding features to Cleansheets in three functional areas:
Core These are requirements that are related to the architecture and common functionalities of Cleansheets as well as one special extension called CRM (Customer Relationship Management).
Languages These are requirements that are related to the formulas of Cleansheets and other aspects related to languages, parsers and grammars.
IPC These are requirements that explore inter-process communication (local or networking).
The 2017/18 edition of LAPR4 is the first one that moves Cleansheets from the desktop into the Web.
This new version of Cleansheets (also known as csheets) is baptized as nsheets (aka NetSheets)
This new version is a Rich Internet Application (RIA) that continues to be developed essentially in Java.
The base technolgy is GWT. Google Web Toolkit, or GWT, is an open source set of tools that allows web developers to create and maintain complex JavaScript front-end applications in Java.
The project uses GWTP, a complete model-view-presenter framework to simplify GWT development.
The Project also uses GWT Material, a framework that adds Material Design look and feel for GWT Apps.

m:MaterialLabel.text: The aims of the LAPR4 course are dual: introduce students to agile software project development; introduce students to an ongoing software development project where they need to work in a large team with an agile approach, applying best practices and techniques.
